title: Pinocchio
description: A wooden puppet embarks on a thrilling adventure to become a real boy.

reviews.text: As a fluent Italian I find it bewildering that some have suggested that hearing the Italian version makes a significant difference ... Benigni's constant yelling was incredibly irritating, the pacing was tortuous, and the neverending parade of pointless set-pieces made me wonder if anyone ever asked anyone else "why?" during any stage in the planning and editing of this film. This film is a complete and utter failure in so many ways that I was embarrassed for its set designer and cinematographer ... that their incredible work went to such a narcissistic waste of time and money.
Horrível até demais, acho que as crianças bobinhas adoraram essa peça rídicula mal feita e sem a mínima noção de carácter simplesmente um estrago para as telas.

This movie contains my favorite movie scene of all times. When the Blue fairy (Nicoletta Braschi) says : "E vero, Medoro, il tempo non esiste".  If I have to pick ONE movie from all movie history, I will pick this one. A great take on the Collodi original. From that point of view the Disney cartoon sucked. It was even anti-Italian. The only negative thing about Benigni's Pinocchio was the English dubbed version. Atrocious. The Italian original was simply glorious.
What is this? You gotta be kidding me!

This is a MASSIVE SPOILER, but they did not have the money to hire a child actor to look like Pinocchio or they rushed production, but Pinocchio does not, I repeat... does not turn into a real boy!This is a crime, this is a fable, and fables cannot be altered un such way that they are destroyed, Disney had one job, and it was to grant Pinocchio's wish to become a real boy. Instead of a half-assed explanation of "he was always real."
Wretchedly dubbed, wretchedly acted, featuring a little Italian nutjob.
